THERE IS ALSO A LIST OF FOOD ITEMS ON A PRINTED STICKER AFFIXED TO THE BOX.

item.title: Report E-2023040117
item.description:
Report E-2023040117

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-20T09:10:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-05
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal UBY experienced a UN1760 "Clothesline Fresh Xtreme Laundry Sour" release from (2) 5-gallon poly pails due to improper loading. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed that 2 pails of Clothesline Fresh Xtreme Laundry Sour released approximately 2-ounces of to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor. The pails were crushed by the pallet falling over during transit due to improper securement. Absorbents and neutralizers were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All released product was collected and containerized into a 15-gallon & 55-gallon poly drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: A courier at or station in Rancho Cordova offered a package to their Dangerous Goods Specialist When they became concerned package contained batteries not properly prepared for travel. With Management present, the package was inspected and inside the padded pack was a small white box containing a "Li-ion Battery Pack" "Part No : RX4000, Rating : 3.7V 1250mAh." There were no marks nor labels on the package to indicate a battery was inside. Package held pending FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2023040159
item.description:
Report E-2023040159

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-20T09:10:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-14
  • City: RICHMOND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Veolia picked the drum on 3/2/23 from the shipper and was shipped to Veolia's 10 day intrasit facility in Fremont, CA. The drum was loaded onto a trailer to proceed to its final destination and was received at the Veolia Richmond TSDF on 3/9. The facility began the offloading process on 3/14/23. When they opened the trailer, they noticed a cubic yard box laying on its side and a drum missing a lid. The contents of the drum was on the top of surrounding drums along with visible staining on the nearby walls of the trailer and cubic yard boxes. It appeared there was a chemical reaction which generated pressure inside the drum which eventually led to the top flying off and causing the cubic yard box which was loaded directly on top of the drum to flip. Veolia believes that during transportation from the Veolia Fremont transfer facility to the Richmond site, agitation occurred in which allowed for a chemical reaction causing the pressure to build up and likely the rupture of the drum was instant. Veolia personnel offloaded the trailer and thoroughly wiped down the drums along with the trailer. The drum along with all spill clean up debris was containerized into a salvage drum.

  • Description: On 3/7/23, at approximately 1200, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 83777 at the station location in Imperial, reporting an undeclared dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of one (1) plastic drum containing light cure adhesive solution. The sds classified the shipment as UN3082 Environmentally hazardous suststance. Due to the amount shipped, this shipment was required to ship fully regulated; however, the drum was found without the proper markings, label, and paperwork for IATA compliance. The shipment is being held for an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2023030483
item.description:
Report X-2023030483

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-20T09:10:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-09
  • City: FONTANA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 3-9-23/0559 C: When 165 personnel were working the trlr/83923 they noticed instead of having one 5 gallon pail of UN1866 (resin ~solution) that was damaged and leaking they had 20 pails of the UN1866 that were leaking and damaged. The spill inside the trlr had ~slowly run from the nose of the trlr to the rear. The spill inside of the trlr was absorbed by cement powder instead of staydry. The resin ~solution (a "little" thick) had dripped and ran out of the nose of the trlr onto the hardtop under the trlr from the nose to the rear of the trlr. ~There is no run off at or around the trlr, it h as all settled in the area under the trlr and onto the tires of the trlr. 165 has placed the HM ~Socks around the trlr to prevent runoff. The plastic pails were on 2 pallets of the UN1866 and shifting freight caused the damage to the ~cracked and punctured plastic pails. The trlr is at the 165 dock door 109, the trlr is empty with cement powder on the resin spill inside the ~trlr, the resin spill under the trlr is contained at the trlr and has HM socks around the trlr to prevent any run off from the resin solution ~away from the area under the trlr. NOTE: 165 is requesting a HM cleanup of th e area under the trlr and the inside of the empty trlr.

No diamond labels or markings of any kind were found on the package. Package appeared to have been repacked before a 40 code was applied to package on 2/25/23, and the battery was found upside down in the box. DescribePack: Car battery leaking from top post. Battrey was upside down in the box. DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: Package placed it a hazbag lined haz tote.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in the unload. being unloaded in the trailer. Package was noticed to be wet, and manager called QA to check it out. DescribePack: Further inspection shown that the Package's orientation arrows were not facing up, they were facing sideways. With a lot of packages that were heavy on top of the hazmat, the hazmat was crushed and leaked out one whole can of liquid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a tote lined with a hazardous materials bag and zip tied. The package was then taken to the HMPA for further processing. The affected package had to be placed onto a pallet and the affected areas on the box were removed and stored with the damaged hazmat in the HWSA.

item.title: Report X-2023030617
item.description:
Report X-2023030617

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-20T09:10:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-04
  • City: SANTA MARIA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brought to the belt via tugger and was put onto the belt and then loaded into route. Manager noticed it was damaged and removed it from the truck and brought it to the back of the belt. DescribePack: After being informed about the damaged hazmat put on PPE put the package in a double lined red bin and inspected it with 2 layers of nitrile gloves on. For the most part this package was not damaged except for where the package had leaked out. A closer look revealed that the corner of the box had been pushed in on the top at the corner of the box. I opened the package and inside was a single 1 gallon plastic bottle, and it was apparent that the cap had become loose and as a result it spilled. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as I was informed about the damaged hazmat I immediately went and put on 2 layers of nitrile gloves, grabbed a red lined bin, and a roll of absorbent pads. After that I put the package into a plastic bag and then into the red hazmat bin.

item.description:
Report E-2023020535

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-20T09:10:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-27
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal UBY experienced a UN3265 Chemtreat CL215 release from (2) 55-gallon poly drums due to a forklift puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of product released to a 6' x 28' area of the trailer floor and a 4' x 20' area of the asphalt lot below the trailer due to a forklift puncture. Each damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The cleanup debris was then collected into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: Yard employees reported the UMXU 238520 as a top container on a double stack releasing liquid onto the bottom unit and well car. Upon inspection of the unit the load was found shifted and two 5-gallon jerricans smashed from the load shift. The blocking and bracing was inadequate for the weight of the load and the blocking and bracing failed allowing the load shift. The containers and well car were cleaned and remediated. The load was re-worked and blocked and braced for transportation.

QA then placed Leaky Hazmat inside a Haz Bag with absorbent and placed that bag inside a Haz tote to stop source of leak to spread. Tote was then placed in vent in Haz processing cage to mitigate the odor.

item.title: Report X-2023020155
item.description:
Report X-2023020155

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-20T09:10:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-04
  • City: SAN BERNARDINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 02/04/2023 BNSF received notification from San Bernardino Hub personnel that unit ESTU 501149 (Loaded Hazmat) was observed leaking after the unit was deramped from the railcar at the San Bernardino Intermodal Facility. In the interest of safety, the unit was placed inside of the Hazmat containment pit pending a cargo inspection. Environmental contractor (United Pumping) was dispatched to perform a cargo inspection and to remediate the leaking product along with the affected areas. Interior inspection revealed mixed palletized freight varying in sizes and weights with a secondary layer on load bars, the pallets were stowed two rows wide throughout the container, there was no cargo securement applied on this shipment which is required per the BNSF Intermodal Rules and Policies Guide. Upon further investigation a failed pallet loaded with "Motor City Clearcoat" UN1263 was found to be the source of the leak. 6 bottles containing 1.325 U.S. Gallons were found empty and 20 more were found to be damaged and leaking for a total of approximately 10 gallons spilled that did reach the ground. Contractor was able to contain and remediate the spill and all affected areas. The shipment was reloaded / secured with seal 27670600 .

  • Description: Dangerous Goods Administration received a call on 16 Jan 2023 concerning a spill which had been discovered by a courier during their delivery route. Part of a 2 piece shipment, it was reported that during the route, one of the plastic drums containing 5 liters of UN 1760 was able to become unsecured during travel. With its free movement in the vehicle, the lid of the drum came off and spilled its entire contents on in the back of the truck. Spill was neutralized allowing for truck to be cleaned. Station contacted shipper who requested package to be destroyed.

  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal ULA experienced a cargo release of UN1219 "Isopropanol Alcohol 99%" from a 55-gallon metal drum due to a nail puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to assist with cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to the dock floor due to a nail puncture. The material evaporated prior to contractors arrival therefore there was no spill to clean. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023020018
item.description:
Report X-2023020018

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-12
  • City: OAKLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 1/12/2023 at approximately 1200, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 986791, at the hub facility in Oakland, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consists of 27 fiberboard boxes, each two plastic bags inside. Each bag holds 1 can of paint. One of the boxes emitted a strong odor, gaining the attention of the agent. Further investigation revealed that both cans appeared to be dented inside of the bags and drops of paint were discovered inside of the bag. The outer package appeared damp in one corner, but no other physical damage was present. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended shipper's declaration to be returned to the shipper.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 27, 2023, fifteen (15) 5-gallon pails of paint fell from a lift gate and released approximately 45 gallons of paint to the lift gate and asphalt pavement. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services LC, who dispatched a crew from Statewide Environmental Services (SES) to remediate the impacted surfaces. SES personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to break down the product, then pressure washed the remaining staining. All paint-impacted material was collected into eleven (11) 55-gallon drums for transport and disposal.

  • Description: HXIL 9354 was found in the Stockton, CA yard to be leaking paint-like product. Container was initially called non-HAZ since no HAZ was on the waybill. Upon inspection/unloading the container, the contractor found that there were multiple drums of an undeclared HAZ paint product. Two 55-gallon drums suffered damage, one drum lost about 20 gallons, the second drum failed toward the bottom of the drum resulting in about a 50-gallon release. The leakage was cleaned up and the container reloaded.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-12
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When package was in transit driver noticed the package was wet. Driver placed package inside a tote and gave it to QA for inspection. When Qa inspected the package 1 out of the 2 bottles had a loose cap which caused it to leak. DescribePack: Shipper didn't provide enough inner packaging leaving space for movement, causing the cap to get loose and leak. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a plastic tote by the driver to contain the leakage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: At 0014 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal USA. It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of "Keeper Professional Post Harvest" UN1908 was released from 55-gallon poly drum due to a puncture. The release impacted trailer floor. ERTS dispatched a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 6' x 10' area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was containerized into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area and then containerized into two 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 1/12/2023 at approximatley 1200, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 986791, at the hub facility in Oakland, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consists of 27 fiberboard boxes, each two plastic bags inside. Each bag holds 2 cans of paint. One of the boxes emitted a strong odor, gaining the attention of the agent. Further investigation revealed that 2 cans appeared to be dented inside one of the bags and drops of paint were discovered inside of the bag. The outer package appeared damp in one corner, but no other physical damage was present. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended shipper's declaration to be returned to the shipper.

Report E-2023010278

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-10
  • City: STOCKTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal UST reported that there was a 0.5-gallon spill of regulated UN1789 "Klean-Strip Muriatic Acid" that was released, impacting the concrete dock floor. The caller stated that the release was the result of a forklift puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-quarts of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the dock floor and adjacent freight due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area. Impacted freight included 15 other 1-gallon jugs of Muriatic Acid, twenty 1-gallon metal cans of Acetone, and Eight 1-gallon metal cans of Premium Paint and Epoxy Remover. All waste was separated by product and containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly and (2) 55-gallon metal drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On January 4, 2022 at 1414 ET, XPO Logistics (ULA terminal) contacted ERTS regarding a UN3109, Organic Peroxice, Type F, Liquid, (Peroxyacetic Acid), 5.2 II release. It was advised that up to 0.5-gallon of product released in a trailer from an unknown container. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 3' x 1' area of the trailer floor. Crew advised every jug in the shipment would continue to release in transit as they all had faulty leaking caps. All jugs were placed into nine 55-gallon poly drums. The cleanup debris was placed into a separate 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to the trailer floor in a 1' x 1' area due to a puncture. When the contractors arrived, the material had already evaporated. The damaged pail was placed into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2023010130
item.description:
Report I-2023010130

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-21
  • City: Los Angeles
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A passengers vape device caught fire in his bag under his seat and started to bum with his personal belongings. Passengers in the aft cabin yelled fire and I looked up and could see smoke in the aft cabin. Flight Attendant was working the cart during a service with another Flight Attendant. We pushed the cart immediately into the first class galley and one Flight Attendant grabbed the PBE and another Flight Attendant grabbed the fire extinguisher from the stowage spot. Flight Attendant just grabbed the first extinguisher they found since they didn't know at this time what kind of fire we were dealing with and didn't want to run to the back with nothing and then have to go back for an extinguisher thus possibly wasting valuable time. We arrived to the aft cabin and by this time another passenger who happened to be a Federal Air Marshall had already grabbed the device and placed it in the mid cabin Iavatory sink. We made sure the fire was out by continuing to run water on it while we went through the passengers bag to ensure that it was also no longer a threat. The passenger was totally compliant and admitted it was his device and offered any assistance we needed. After the fire was out we calmed down a few concerned passengers and Flight Attendant #4 who was a bit shaken and then resumed our duties. No one was hurt and we landed safely in L.A. FA#2 was in the aft Iav and was not involved directly and FA#1 was the communicator with the flight deck.

item.title: Report I-2022120314

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-04
  • City: Los Angeles

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Just prior to landing in Los Angeles, a customer's Apple MacBook Pro laptop was overheating and emitting smoke. The customer stood up and was holding the smoking laptop in his hand. The Flight Attendants responded with the Fire Containment Bag and instructed the customer to place the laptop in it. They then added water to the bag to cool the battery and stop the thermal runaway. Landing was uneventful. The customer requested and was provided bum gel for his fingers upon arrival in Los Angeles.

Further investigation indicated the box contained a bottle of wine and a metal can of butane lighter fluid which is fully regulated as UN1950 Aerosols Flammable. There was no release. There were no dangerous goods markings or labels on the packaging, and no Shippers Declaration for Dangerous Goods was offered with the shipment. The following package is being held pending further disposition.

item.title: Report X-2022120436
item.description:
Report X-2022120436

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-06
  • City: PITTSBURG
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The HOKX 112231 was involved in a derailment while the train was pulling cars from the industry. 6 cars in total derailed with 5 ending on their sides. The HOKX 112231 suffered damaged below the bottom outlet valve assembly when the secondary 2" ball valve was sheared from the car. Trapped potassium hydroxide between the primary BOV closure and the secondary valve (less than 1 gal) released to the ballast and truck/rail assembly. Responders used a neutralizing agent to neutralize the spilled acid on the components. The primary BOV valve was inspected and ensured to be fully closed.

  • City: San Diego
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 12/05/2022 at approximately 1000, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 312048 at the station location in San Diego, reporting a unknown spill. The shipment consisted of a small glass bottle inside of a plastic bag, all inside of a FedEx-branded box. The identity of the liquid is unknown, however the reporting agent stated that the liquid emitted a pungent odor. And although the bottle was incasesd in the bag, it appeared to leak inside of the box. The shipment is being held for an FAA investigation.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 9, 2022, two (2) 5-gallon pails of printing ink (UN1210) were damaged due to a load shift and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior and asphalt roadway. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services to perform the necessary corrective actions. Ancon personnel utilized absorbents, cleaning solution, and hand tools to remediate the impacted surfaces, then containerized all printing ink-impacted material in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal by RLC.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 2, 2022, one (2) 50-pound bag of sodium hydroxide was torn due to a load shift and released approximately twenty-five (25) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Aricon Services (AS) to perform the necessary corrective actions. AS personnel utilized absorbents, neutralizing agents, and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface, then containerized all sodium hydroxide-impacted material into two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2022120387
item.description:
Report E-2022120387

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-08
  • City: FRESNO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 8, 2022, at 1515 ET, XPO Logistics Terminal UFN experienced release of UN1824 “Car Brite Hot Stuff Concentrated Heavy Duty Degreaser” from a 5-gallon poly pail. The release impacted the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. No soils, drains, or waterways were reported to have been impacted by this release. ERTS dispatched Patriot Environmental Services to conduct all on site cleanup activities. On December 8, 2022, at 1651 EST, Patriot personnel arrived on site and advised terminal personnel had placed the waste into a 30-gallon metal drum. Crew collected the damaged jug and all cleanup debris from the metal drum and properly containerized the material into a 55-gallon poly drum. The metal drum was cleaned and sanitized for future use. All waste was left onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: I This was actually a passenger misconduct and not a hazmat incident as initially reported. The passenger George Nicolas was locking himself in the Iavatory for 45 minutes at a a time. He came out of the Iav and had a vaping device in his hand. The Flight Attendant informed him that vaping was not allowed and he said he wasn't vaping. Later, the passenger's seated next to him said he was playing with a lighter and they were very uncomfortable with him. The Flight Att6ndant asked him for the lighter and he gave it to them. An hour later the passengers said he had another Iightel^ that he kept playing with. When the Flight Attendant walked up to him he immediately gave them the lighter and^said he didn't know he had it. He also gave the vaping device to my coworker. At the captains request, he was issued a PIDR and he was met by AA Security when we landed.

  • Description: Yard employees reported liquid releasing from the valve area on the bottom rear of the container. Upon inspection the release was found coming from the flange connection between the valve and tank body. The four flange bolts were tightened slowing the release down but did not stop the release. Containment was placed under the container and the load was transloaded into SEGU804106 on the same day. Once the TIFU 126059 was empty the release stopped. The containers were secured, and the shipper was notified of the transfer completion.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0752 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UBY. It was reported that approximately 16 ounces of Nalmet 1689 released from a 55-gallon plastic drum due to a packaging error in the seal. The release impacted the top of the drum. ERTS dispatched a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed a 55-gallon poly drum of Nalmet 1689 had released approximately 1 cup of material to the top of the drum from a compromised bung cap. Contractors overpacked the drum into an 85 gallon poly drum and staged the drum on-site for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-08
  • City: ADELANTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0632 ET XPO logistics terminal UAD called to report a 5 ounce release of corrosive product "Crew Restroom Floor and Surface Non Acid Disinfectant Cleaner" due to improper stacking during transit. The release impacted the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-ounces of product released to the trailer floor in a 6' x 10' area. One jug was damaged as a result of being crushed. The material impacted 16 other jugs of product. All impacted cardboard, absorbents, and 16 impacted jugs were collected and containerized into two 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage. 2. E-2022120195 During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of disinfectant cleaner (un1903) had been crushed and that one of the inner poly 1 gallon bottle had released 5 ounces of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM LOAD SIDE WET. ONE OF THE CONTENTS IS CRUSHED SLIGHTLY DUE TO AN IMPACT. CRUSH CAUSED CONTENTS TO CRACK. item.title: Report I-2022120073
item.description:
Report I-2022120073

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-04
  • City: Ontario
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING THE PM SORT OPERATIONS AT THE FEDEX EXPRESS SORT FACILITY IN ONTARIO, CA A FIBERBOARD BOX WAS LEAKING. FURTHER INVESTIGATION INDICATED THE BOX CONTAINED POTENTIAL UNDECLARED DG. THE BOX CONTAINED A PLASTIC BOTTLE OF UN1805 PHOSPHORIC ACID SOLUTION PGIII WHICH LEAKED OUT FROM BEING DAMAGED DURING PACKAGE HANDLING ON THE SORT. THERE WERE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKINGS OR LABELS ON THE PACKAGING, AND NO SHIPPERS DECLARATION FOR DANGEROUS GOODS WAS OFFERED WITH THE SHIPMENT. FOLLOWING SPILL CLEANUP, THE INVOLVED PACKAGE WAS PLACED INSIDE OF A SALVAGE DRUM AND HELP PENDING FURTHER DISPOSITION INSTRUCTIONS.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During transfer operations, employee double stacked cubic yard boxes containing several 1 gallon cans of paint. There were a total of two cubic yard boxes of paint related material. One of the CYB was place on top of the other during transfer operations. The weight of the material crushed the CYB it was placed on. Current procedures prohibit this activity. The spill was cleaned up immediately. Incident occurred at Ingenium's exempt 10-Day transfer station. Preparer was notified on 11/15/22 of the event. It was reported a day later after determination that the 100# RQ was not exceeded.

  • Description: At 0951 ET, XPO logistics terminal UOA called to report a 3 gallon release of a corrosive toxic liquid on dock door 45 and the bay. The poly tote of product was punctured by a nail during unloading. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. At 1602 ET, contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5 gallons of product released to a 5' x 15' area of the dock and a 5' x 20' area of the concrete lot below the dock. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were worked into the impacted areas and collected. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into three 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022110099
item.description:
Report E-2022110099

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-19
  • City: NEWPORT BEACH
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 19, 2022, the Veolia driver and technician arrived at the generator's site around 8am and started to offload supplies and prepare for the waste containers to be loaded on to the truck. Once they finished offloading the supplies, a third Veolia employee operating a forklift began loading five 85 gal 1H2 poly salvage drums onto the truck. Each 85 gallon salvage drum contained a compromised 55 gallon 1H1 drum containing 96% sulfuric acid. The forklift operator placed the drums on the tail end of the straight truck and the two Veolia personnel utilized a pallet jack to move the drums to the nose of the straight truck. When they went to get the the fifth drum, they noticed the 4th drum started to bulge on top. Shortly after, they noticed a mist was visible near the drum and the employees immediately exited out of the box of the straight truck. The Veolia employees observed the drum from outside of the truck and could see it was increasing in pressure and bulging. The drum eventually ruptured due to the pressure and started to release the liquid and absorbent that was placed inside the salvage drum. The total duration of the reaction and release was roughly 30 minutes and the estimated quantity of hazardous material that spilled out of the package was roughly 2 gallons. The Veolia employees contained the spill by laying down visqueen and spill pads under the truck due to the sulfuric acid leaking through the floorboards onto the ground. They donned level B PPE and re-containerized the drum. This drum was left on the generator's site and was not shipped. Veolia employees completed the spill response and neutralized the acid that had leaked out.

  • Description: ERTS was contacted by Roadrunner regarding an approx. 3 gallon UN3266 Corrosive Liquid spill of "Bravo - Heavy Duty Low Odor Stripper" from several poly cartons on a skid. The spill location is on the concrete dock at door in Livermore, CA. The caller has requested a contractor out for cleanup and containment. ERTS dispatched Patriot Environmental Services. Patriot has arrived onsite and located the release. There appear to be about 5 to 6 boxes that are impacted by the product. Impacted freight was segregated from good freight. Patriot solidified the released liquids and collected and containerized the waste for pending disposal. The release was contained to the concrete dock floor and surrounding freight and wooden pallets only.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in the unload and brought to the HWPA because when they tried to move the box and tilted it to the side they noticed that something sloshed inside. The manager stopped immediately and he called for QA to come and take the package and make sure it was safe for OTR. Package was discovered to have a leak that would "appear" when the package was titled to one side. DescribePack: the closure on the jug was torn/damaged from one side and the lid on the jug was crooked which allowed for the leak to form. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: we bagged the item and placed it in a hazmat drum to prevent any more leaks from happening.

item.title: Report X-2022100874
item.description:
Report X-2022100874

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-03
  • City: SANTA MARIA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I was assisting my qa team today and when I came to belt 3 it was sitting on a pallet near the QA computer station. I noticed it was paint materials and immediately put it in a lined bin at around 7:30am. DescribePack: Upon discovery of the package there was a distinct odor and the package itself was wet on the top of the box and some of the side and bottom. The tape that sealed it wasn't an issue to which I will elude to later. I found the contents of the package to be boat paint sealer and the cap clips that would usually hold a can of paint's cover in place were in an upward position. Unsure of how they up like that but as a result the covers on both cans of paint were slightly popped open enough for a few ounces to come out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Initially I grabbed a surgical mask and double gloved before going anywhere near the package and then put the damaged package into a lined black bin just in case the leaking hadn't subsided and then checked to make sure the cans were facing up as well.

Upon inspection it was clear that the package had an internal leakage. DescribePack: The lid of the bottle was found to not have a proper seal and the cap was loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA responded quickly and promptly to the call for a leaking package. The spilled was contained to the inside of the box but we still placed the box inside a haz mat bag for further inspection.

  • Description: On October 13, 2022, three (3) pails of Hydroline 34 (contains hydrogen peroxide) were damaged during transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete surface below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Statewide Emergency Services (SES) to perform the necessary corrective actions. SES personnel utilized vermiculite and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface, then containerized all Hydroline 34-impacted material, and the three (3) damaged pails, into two (2) 55-gallon drums and one (1) 15-gallon drum for disposal by R+L Carriers.

  • Description: At 0920 ET, XPO terminal UST contacted ERTS to report a spill that occurred inside a trailer in Stockton, CA. The spill consisted of (1) 5 gallon plastic pail of Zep Industrial Purple Degreaser. The release impacted the trailer floor due to a suspected loose cap. ERTS dispatched Patriot Environmental to conduct cleanup operations. At 1550 ET, Patriot personnel arrived onsite and advised XPO terminal personnel completed cleanup operations. The impacted absorbents and damaged jerrican were placed into a 55 gallon poly drum. The waste was left onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CTCX 733536 identified by Mechanical as releasing from top of car. Upon inspection, the liquid line was slightly open with a loose liquid line plug. The liquid line was closed and plug secured. Contractor was mobilized to decontaminate exterior and due to no active release from liquid line, a secondary release from vacuum relief valve was identified due to increasing pressure from initial securement. VRV was removed and replaced with plug and OTMA applied to continue movement.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-02
  • City: Victorville
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE BOX APPEARED TO HAVE A STAIN BUT UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS THIS PACKAGE MAY HAVE BEEN SPILLED ON FROM ANOTHER UNKNOWN PACKAGE. THE CONTENTS DID NOT APPEAR TO HAVE LEAKED. HOWEVER, AMONG THE CONTENTS WAS A LYSOL DISINFECTANT SPRAY (AEROSOL), 19 OZ/570 G. THIS IS UN 1950, AEROSOLS NONFLAMMABLE, DIVISION 2.2, NON-FLAMMABLE GAS. HOWEVER THE SHIPPER DID NOT OFFER THE SHIPMENT WITH ANY DG MARKS, LABELS, NOR A SHIPPER’S DECLARATION SO IT IS UNDECLARED/HIDDEN DG. THERE WERE ADDITIONAL CONTENTS: A) GLOVE, B) HAND SANITIZER, SEVERAL TYPES ETHYL ALCOHOL BASED; DUE TO THE SPECIFIC INNER PACKAGING TYPES AND SIZES, PER PACKAGE AMOUNT BASED; DUE TO THE SPECIFIC INNER PACKAGING TYPES AND SIZES, PER PACKAGE AMOUNT LESS THAN 192 OZ AND 66 LBS. AND DOMESTIC IT WAS ELIGIBLE TO BE NONHAZARDOUS UNDER 49CFR 173.150 (G). THERE WAS ALSO A PUMP SPRAY SANITIZING SPRAY, IT DID NOT SAY FLAMMABLE OR HAVE ANY GHS LABELS, AND SOME ALCOHOL WIPES WHICH MIGHT BE ELIGILBLE FOR IATA SPECIAL PROVISION A46 AS NONHAZ IF THE CRITERIA FOR A46 IS MET. THIS SHIPMENT WAS HELD FOR FAA. THE FAA WAS NOTIFIED VIA EMAIL AND PHOTOS SENT.

  • Description: On Sept 1 at approximately 1005 the SMFA station contacted DG Admin about a spill on the truck that was out in the field. The courier noticed a package containing UN1990 had leaked through and on to the truck. Upon opening the package one glass bottle broke and the contents spilled. there was not enough absorbent material to contain the spill. DG Admin instructed the spill specialist to place the package in a salvage drum, hold until further disposition, and to clean out the truck.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-26
  • City: LAKE FOREST
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal UIV contacted ERTS to report the unspecified amount of regulated UN1789 "Muriatic Acid" that was released from an unknown amount of 1-gallon size plastic containers. The release impacted the concrete flooring around Dock# 41. ERTS dispatched Patriot to conduct cleanup. At 1630 ET, Patriot personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 gallon of product released from 1 jug to the pallet. The pallet was broken down and all impacted cardboard removed. Freight was wiped down and re-stacked for shipment on. The area was neutralized and the damaged jug plus all cleanup debris was placed into a 55 gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: At 0954 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a release at terminal UBF. It was reported that approximately 1 ounce of UN2735 Hostavin 3055 LIQ was released from a 20-gallon plastic drum due to the drum being crushed. The release impacted the pallet. ERTS dispatched Patriot to conduct all onsite cleanup. At 1545 ET, Patriot arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5 ounce of product released to the drum. The damaged drum was collected and containerized into a 55 gallon poly drum. The waste was left onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-04
  • City: BLOOMINGTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought back to station leaking by driver. Upon arrival, PM QA placed package in tote and turned jerrican right-side up to prevent further leakage. Upon inspection, clear hazmat markings were on the container and it was found that pkg was an undeclared hazmat. No markings were found on the outside of the box. SPIDR images show white box in phoenix and package was discovered in a brown box. DescribePack: Jerrican was leaking from the lid area. Less than 1 inch opening around seal from package being placed upside down & on its side. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Driver was not aware that package was a hazmat so only precautions taken were isolating the package and turning it right-side up.

  • Description: The KAG West, LLC was delivering gasoline into the customer's storage tank when the connection between the hose adaptor and the storage tank became compromised. This allowed approximately 200 gallons of gasoline to be released. The local fire department and US Ecology responded to the scene and handled the remediation. Upon further investigation, it appears that a missing O ring on the hose adaptor was the cause of the spill.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: GATX 220850 released 0.5 gallons of product from the bottom outlet valve (BOV). Point of release was at BOV nozzle threads and cap. The cap was tool tight and the BOV was in the closed position. The nozzle cap was backed off, Teflon tape applied to the nozzle threads and then the cap was tightened. This stopped the release.

  • City: SAN DIEGO

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 26, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3082 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Patriot Environmental Services (PES) to complete the necessary corrective actions. PES personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface, then containerized all waste into one (1) 95-gallon drum and two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report X-2022091409
item.description:
Report X-2022091409

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-15
  • City: STOCKTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Patriot completed the remediation in the evening, 9/15/22. The Sherwin Williams paint base AK263B was the source (Hazmat reportable). Est. 15 gals leaked from a small hole in the bottom (loading or preloading damage). RNLU100553 (Hazmat declared) was reported by the BNSF Stockton hub, as leaking an unknown liquid on 9/15/22. It was moved to the leaker pit. This is actively leaking at ~ 20 drops/min of a slightly milky liquid, from the midpoint area, with less than 1 quart released in the pit so far. The interior inspection found mixed LTL cargo with 8ea 55gal metal drums of suspected Sherwin Williams paint Intermediate. No cargo securement was used for this product & the only securement in the load was 2 ratchet straps at the rear.

item.title: Report X-2022091407
item.description:
Report X-2022091407

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-09
  • City: Walnut
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RNLU100211 (Hazmat declared) was reported at the BNSF Stockton hub by a shipper pickup driver, as leaking an unknown liquid on the evening of 9/7/22. It was moved to the leaker pit & at the time was noted as non active. A LARS inspection on 9/8/22 found an active leak of ~ 20 drops/min of a milky liquid, from midpoint towards the rear, with less than 2 gals released in the pit at time of inspection. The interior inspection found mixed LTL cargo with a pallet of 5 gal pails of Sani Soft fallen over (Corrosive Class 8). No cargo securement for this product & the only securement was 1 ratchet strap & an OSB panel at the rear.

  • Description: At 1345 ET, XPO Logistics terminal USB called to request assistance with a release of UN1823 Sodium Hydroxide. The release impacted the dock at dock door 73. ERTS dispatched Patriot Environmental to conduct cleanup. At 1628 ET, Patriot personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product released to a 6' x 6" area of the dock floor. The damaged box containing the impacted jugs and damaged jug were containerized into a 55 gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 20, 2022, eight (8) one-gallon pails of paint were crushed during transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Parc Environmental (PE) to complete the necessary corrective actions. Per request by the terminal personnel, PE personnel containerized thirty (30) one-gallon pails of product into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew then deployed absorbents and worked them in with hand tools. All paint-impacted solids were contained in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

PE personnel containerized the damaged pails in two (2) 55-gallon drums, then deployed absorbents and collected all paint-impacted solids into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

I checked what the issue was, it appears that the cause of failure was due to a small crack on the top of the bottle; near the cap. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: placed in a lined tote. package was faced up, where the orientation arrows were pointing.

item.title: Report I-2022110153
item.description:
Report I-2022110153

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-10
  • City: Dubai
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A piece of luggage was offered by the shipper. Customs spot checked this shipment and opened it. Among the contents were included two 400 g metal aerosol cans of antiperspirant with flammable Globally Harmonized System (GHS) pictograms. The manufacturer's safety data sheet indicates that the correct identification/classification is UN 1950, Aerosols flammable, division 2.1, flammable gas. These had been held in customs for some time before FedEx Express was notified in UAE. DG Administration was made aware of this incident on 8/10/22. As the shipper had not offered the shipment with any DG marks, labels nor a shipper's declaration it is undeclared/hidden DG. The competent authority in United Arab Emirates was notified by local personnel in UAE, Reporting Dangerous Goods Occurrence (RODGO) number 0003255122 to the UAE General Civil Aviation Authority. I notified FAA via their email process and photos were sent on 8/10. Once released by the competent authority in UAE the DG will be removed from the luggage for local environmental disposal in order for the remainder of the package to be delivered.

  • Description: ON 08/27/2022 AT APPROXIMATELY 0400, DANGEROUS GOODS ADMINISTRATION RECEIVED A CALL FROM EMPLOYEE 4080418 AT THE HUB FACILITY IN OAKLAND, REPORTING A TOXIC SPILL. THE SHIPMENT WAS A GLASS BOTTLE INSIDE OF A FIBERBOARD BOX. THE SHIPMENT WAS DISCOVERED WITH A STAINED OUTER PACKAGE. FURTHER RESEARCH SHOWED THE CLOSURE WAS NOT SECURED ON THE BOTTLE, RESULTING IN THE LEAKAGE. THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM AND AWAITS PACKAGE RETRIEVAL BY THE SHIPPER.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UKC called in to report a 5-ounce spill of UN 1790 Alum-Brite from a 5-gallon plastic pail caused by a forklift puncture during unloading. The release impacted the pallet it was transported on as well as the dock for near doors 32 and 93. ERTS dispatched Patriot Environmental to conduct cleanup. At 1128 ET, Patriot personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 6 ounces of product released to a 6' x 4' area of the dock floor. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area and collected along with the damaged pail into a 55 gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022090149
item.description:
Report E-2022090149

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-17
  • City: AZUSA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Veolia employee was off loading a trailer at Veolia's ten day intransit facility in Azusa, CA. The trailer contained a pallet of containers stretched wrapped together on a pallet. The employee proceeded to remove this pallet with a forklift and while he was attempting to the lift the pallet the forks of the forklift punctured the container. This action resulted in a release of the contents of a single 3 gallon poly closed top container. The forklift operator immediately noticed the release and proceeded to clean up the spill along with other hazmat trained Veolia employees. All spilled material was absorbed with absorbent pads and powder and was repacked into a new 5 gallon container. The cause of the spill was due to broken planks on the pallet which allowed the bottoms of the 3 gallon poly containers to sag below the top deckboard. When the forklift operator placed his forks inside the opening and lifted the pallet, the container got punctured. The entire duration of the spill was less than 1 minute due to the container size.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hub Group Trucking called to request assistance with an unknown amount of of an unknown hazardous liquid release on trailer at location in Patterson, CA. ERTS dispatched Graymar Environmental personnel to respond and remediate the release. Graymar personnel estimated that approximately 20 gallons of UN3265 (Mudslide Cleaner) and approximately 25 gallons of UN3266 (Morado Cleaner) released from (9) 5-gallon poly pails due to a apparent load shift and the pails being partially crushed. The release impacted the trailer floor and adjacent concrete parking lot only. Graymar personnel cleaned the impacted areas and collected and containerized the waste for pending disposal. No drains, soils or waterways were reported as being impacted.

item.title: Report X-2022090038
item.description:
Report X-2022090038

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-18
  • City: SAN BERNARDINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 08/18/2022 LARS received notification from Hub personnel that unit UPGZ 511908 was observed leaking after the unit was deramped from the railcar at the San Bernardino Intermodal Facility. In the interest of safety, the unit was placed inside of the containment pit pending a cargo inspection. Environmental contractor (United Pumping) was dispatched to perform a cargo inspection and to remediate the leaking product along with the affected areas. Interior inspection revealed mixed freight varying in sizes and weights, stacked multiple layers high throughout the container, 3 DID airbags were found deflated and dislodged at the rear of the load no other forms of load securement were applied on this shipment which is required per the BNSF Intermodal Rules and Policies Guide. A metal container containing a purple paint related material was found to be the source of the leak, it has been determined the leak was caused by a failed/loose seal on the lid of the container. Contractor was able to remediate the spill and affected areas. The shipment was reloaded / secured with seal 27670428

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-26
  • City: VALLEJO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 26, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum of Methyl Normal Propyl Ketone (contains ketones) was damaged during a loading shift and released approximately two (2) cups of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GMES) to perform the necessary corrective actions. GMES noted that the release had evaporated, then overpacked the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 95-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2022081367
item.description:
Report X-2022081367

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-01
  • City: BLOOMINGTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by a package handler in trailer 459023. Package was removed from trailer and placed in a plastic bag to prevent further leakage. Upon inspection, it was apparent that the package was loaded on it's side, with the orientation arrows facing horizontally. DescribePack: The lid did not appear to be damaged, but allowed liquid to pass through. The plastic tape around the lid was wet, and there was some liquid in the plastic bag holding the bottle. Most of the leakage was on the bottom and sides of the box. There were no cracked or holes apparent on the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately turned to the correct orientation, placed in to a plastic bag, then a lined plastic tote.

  • Description: On August 18, 2022, one (1) 20-gallon jerrican of paint (UN1263) was crushed in transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GMES) to perform the necessary corrective actions. GMES utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface, then containerized all spent material into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Patriot Environmental Services (PES) to perform the necessary corrective actions. PES personnel utilized absorbent wipes to remediate the impacted surface, then overpacked the damaged drum and all impacted material into one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 95-gallon overpack.

item.title: Report X-2022070953
item.description:
Report X-2022070953

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-15
  • City: STOCKTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2022 07 14 this hazmat shipment was observed leaking after deramp at the Stockton Intermodal Facility. On your behalf a contractor was dispatched to inspect and remediate leaking condition. Interior inspection of the unit revealed a shipment of mixed cargo throughout, double stacked with only a cargo strap for securement. At the rear of the load, one pallet had fallen over causing damage to cargo underneath. Closer inspection revealed a pallet containing 5 gallon buckets of "Hentzen Clear Expoxy Hybrid" which was damaged and leaking. It is estimated that approximately 1 quart of epoxy leaked from 2 buckets (no signs of actual ground contamination). Damaged cargo was overpacked into 55 gallon drums. Trailer was cleaned and waste products were also overpacked into drums. Cargo was reloaded to trailer with drums placed at the rear of the load for ABF safe handling.

item.title: Report X-2022070952
item.description:
Report X-2022070952

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-12
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/12/2022 LARS received notification from Hub personnel that unit JBHU 305907 (Hazmat Load) was observed leaking after the unit was deramped from the railcar at the Los Angeles Intermodal Facility. In the interest of safety, the unit was placed inside of the containment pit pending a cargo inspection. Environmental contractor (United Pumping) was dispatched to perform a cargo inspection and to remediate the leaking product along with the affected areas. Interior inspection revealed mixed palletized freight along with 330 gallon totes varying in sizes and weights throughout the entire unit. A 330 gallon tote at the nose of the unit containing "Fabra Kleen Terminator" (Sodium Hydroxide Solution a corrosive liquid) was found to be leaking due to failed packaging. The contractor was able to remediate the spill and affected areas, the product was transferred in to a new tote. The shipment was reloaded / secured with seal 27670381, this shipment has been released for out gate at the drivers discretion.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the PM sort operations at the FedEx Express ramp in Sacramento, CA a fiberboard box was observed leaking. Further investigation indicated the box contained several cans of Mohawk Ultra Flo Clear Lacquer, which the inner contents of several cans released into the outer packaging. This product is fully regulated as UN1950 Aerosols Flammable. There were no dangerous goods markings or labels on the packaging, and no Shippers Declaration for Dangerous Goods was offered with the shipment. The involved package is being held pending further disposition.

  • Description: Drum was brought to the attention of the spill specialist at our Oakland CA Ramp location. Drum was seen to be leaking from the cap area. It was reported the rubber gasket on which the cap was seated appeared worn. Only a small amount of product was able to escape, and it is estimated less than 10 ML of UN2245 escaped. Drum is being held at location and customers contacted.

item.title: Report I-2022100028
item.description:
Report I-2022100028

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-28
  • City: Sacramento
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: OAK HARBOR FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A driver notified Joe Guzman and I of a leaking trailer, we instructed the driver to bring the leaking trailer to the dock so we can address the leak. I researched the trailer in question (V1952S) and found it contained ten totes of NA1993. We began removing the totes from the trailer, we found a half-emptied tote that was gushing from the bottom; we flipped the tote on its side to prevent losing any more liquid. After we inspect tote, we found the valve on the bottom to be partially open with no cap or retention screw keeping it closed. Clean Harbors finished the clean up and transported the HW.

item.title: Report I-2022090335

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-02
  • City: Monterey
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ON 7/2/2022 AT APPROIMATELY 0830, DANGEROUS GOODS ADMINSTRATION RECEIVED A CALL FROM EMPLOYEE 5080902 AT THE STATION LOCATION IN MONTEREY, REPORTING A POTENTIALLY UNDECLARED PAINT SHIPMENT. THE SHIPMENT CONSISTED OF 4-1 LITER CONTAINERS. THE LID OF ONE OF THE CONTAINERS CRACKED FROM AN UNKNOWN CAUSE, RESULTING IN LEAKAGE. FURTHER INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT THE CONTENTS APPEARS TO BE PAINT AND THE SHIPMENT IS VOID OF THE MARKINGS, LABELING, PACKAGING AND PAPERWORK AS REQUIRED BY IATA. THE FULL PRODUCT NAME IS UNDETERMINED. THE SHIPMENT IS BEING HELD FOR AN FAA INVESTIGATION.

item.title: Report I-2022090309
item.description:
Report I-2022090309

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-14
  • City: Monterey
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was found and brought to the attention of the spill cleanup specialist at our Station in Monterey CA when it was seen a white powder was leaking from a FedEx padded pak. Inspection of the package found 2 bottles of Leisure Time Renew placed in the pack, there was no positive closure on the bottles and one of the caps unscrewed and allowed for all powder inside the package to escape. Sds for product found at https://www.loveyourhottub.com/content/Leisure-Time-Renew-sds.pdf showed the product to be regulated for travel, however, there were no markings nor labels to indicate dangerous goods were traveling. Contents of package have been placed in a steel salvage drum for FAA investigation.

Patriot collected and containerized the damaged pail and all clean-up debris into (1) 55-gallons poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On July 7, 2022, one (1) 2.5-gallon container of Hyper Wheel Cleaner was punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the concrete loading dock. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Patriot Environmental Services (PES) to perform the necessary corrective action. PES personnel drummed the damaged container and utilized absorbents to remediate the impacted surface.

item.title: Report X-2022060420
item.description:
Report X-2022060420

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-03
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Handler noticed a package had a gasoline smell/fumes from from it. They notified the Manager who then notified QA. I came over to assess the situation. I discovered that item inside the package is a portable generator that was being returned to Walmart from a customer. However, the generator was not emptied of the gasoline inside. So, package contained a Hazmat, and a little gasoline leaked out, but did not leak through the outer packaging. I secured cap that contained Gasoline, bagged the box 3 times with Haz Bags, and I safely took package to the Hazmat cage to be processed. DescribePack: The cap of the portable generator was not 100% sealed, and is what caused the small leakage of gasoline. Package also had no indication of Hazmat/Dangerous Goods. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap of portable generator was secured and box was wrapped in Haz Bags 3 times.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS requesting assistance with a spill of UN2735 "Dabco T" from a 55 gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched Patriot to conduct cleanup operations. At 2000 ET, Patriot arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3 gallons of product released to a 5' x 5' area of the trailer floor and concrete lot below. The damaged drum was placed into a 95 gallon poly drum. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted areas and collected into (2) 55 gallon poly drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Manager called on the radio about a hazmat spill at door 212. I went over there with 2 other QA admins. When we got there we saw that the package was wet. I carefully placed in a lined tote while wearing gloves. The package handlers told me that they placed the hazmat in the middle rollers; where they place their NCs, that was when it fell. DescribePack: There was a dent near the top of the drum, causing it to leak. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: We placed the hazmat up where the arrows are facing and then I placed it in a lined tote to prevent further spills.

  • Description: On June 30, 2022, one (1) 275-gallon tote containing polyamines incurred damage during transit and released less-than-one (<1) gallon of product to the concrete loading dock. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Patriot Environmental Services (PES) to perform the necessary corrective action. PES personnel transferred remaining product into a new tote, then utilized absorbents to remediate the impacted surface.

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1110 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UBY. It was reported that approximately 2 pounds of Orthotex Concentrate released from a 55 pound paper bag due to the bag being punctured by a forklift. ERTS dispatched Patriot to conduct cleanup. At 1140 ET, Patriot personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20 pounds of product released to a 4' x 2' area of the dock floor from one bag. The damaged bag and all cleanup debris was collected and containerized into a 35 gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

The passenger let our FA know that his vape pen a Flume Float brand was malfunctioning and he could not get the device to stop smoking. The device was place in a Fire Containment Bag (FCB) with 3 litters of water, the FA let the PIC know about the event. The FCB was monitored by the FA for the last 15 minutes of the flight in the galley. The FCB with device was given to the ACS agents in LAX.

  • City: WILLIAMS

  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR EXPRESS AMERICA, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: on May 29, 2022, Landstar contacted ERTS requesting service related to a 1.5 gallon release of UN 1866 "Nutack 046-466" from a 55 gallon DM. ERTS dispatched a remediation contactor Lonestar to address the reported spill. Following contractor arrival and cargo assessment, it was determined that 1 gallon of product affected an 8’ by 1’ area of trailer flooring and a 1’ x 1’ underlying asphalt area. The leak was observed to be from the bottom of the drum, near the weld seam, where it appeared the drum had been dragged on the ground, which resulted in a “scrape” pattern at the immediate vicinity of the leak. Media affected was subsequently addressed by the contractor and waste generated is currently pending disposal.

item.title: Report X-2022060348
item.description:
Report X-2022060348

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-05-26
  • City: SAN BERNARDINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 05/25/2022 LARS received notification from Hub personnel that unit JBHU 320039 was observed leaking after the unit was deramped from the railcar at the San Bernardino Intermodal Facility. In the interest of safety, the unit was placed inside of the containment pit pending a cargo inspection. Environmental contractor (United Pumping) was dispatched to perform a cargo inspection and to remediate the leaking product along with the affected areas. Interior inspection revealed floor loaded 55 gallon drums of HAZ Aroset PS 6384 Adhesive throughout the container. 1 drum was found to be punctured and leaking in the middle of the unit, the substance leaking did leak to the exterior of the unit with approximately 12oz reaching the ground. Blocking and bracing was applied at the rear of this shipment. Contractor was able to remediate the spill and affected areas, the spilled product was identified as Aroset PS 6384 Adhesive. The shipment was reloaded / secured with seal 27670375

  • Description: At 0901 EST XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at the terminal. It was reported that an unknown amount of Hydrogen peroxide and Peroxyacetic acid mixture was released to the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched Patriot to conduct cleanup. At 1130 ET, Patriot personnel arrived onsite and confirmed the majority of the trailer floor was impacted in a 20' x 8', area and a small area under the trailer measuring 4' x 1'. Both areas were covered with absorbents which were worked in and collected. The damaged drum was containerized into a 95 gallon poly overpack. All cleanup debris was collected into (3) 55 gallon poly drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

When the forklift operator was attempting to move the drum from one pallet to another, the drum tipped over, and fell off of the pallet onto the concrete at the end of the dock.   • Incident Date: 2022-05-12
  • City: SAN DIEGO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Veolia employees were preparing a shipment for transport. 10 x 55 gallon metal drums of organic solvent solution were loaded into the box van utilizing a drum dolly from the shipper's site. The Veolia employees were moving the drums around in order to secure the load when they noticed a wet spot where a drum was sitting. After the employees examined the drum they noticed a small leak originated from the bottom chime which resulting in a small leak, approximately <10 mL. There was no evidence of any spill where the drum was stored nor during the loading process. The drum was overpacked into an 85 gallon salvage drum. Do to the nature of this spill, Veolia believes that it was due to manufacturer's defect which had a compromised chime. There was no evidence of the chime being bent or warp utilizing the drum dolly and inspecting the dolly did not show any sharp edges that would have damaged the chime.
